description.narrative: By end 2021, pregnant and lactating women, women of reproductive age and adolescents have the correct information and capacity to access HIV prevention, testing and treatment services, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Hiv â€“ General, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: Pregnant women, children and adolescents in 10 regions access equitable and friendly quality services for prevention, management and treatment of HIV/AIDS and sexually transmitted infections, reproductive health and gender-based violence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, pregnant and lactating women, women of reproductive age and adolescents have the correct information and capacityto access HIV prevention, testing and treatment services

description.narrative: As of 31 October 2021, as a result of different communication strategies implemented for combined prevention through the usual communication channels (outreach, U-Report, involvement of religious and community groups), 321,460 adolescents/youth were sensitized on HIV prevention and COVID-19 out of a target of 353,529; among them, 163,658 know their HIV status, of whom 674 are positive (4.12%) and 594 are put on ARV treatment. Regarding pregnant women, 389,246 out of 953,165 targeted (40.8%) were sensitized and 346,705/ 953,165 (36,37%) were tested. Among them, 3,713 out of 7,000 targeted (53,04%) and tested HIV positive were put on ART. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/01/2022
